intro: Atriplex cinerea, commonly known as silverleaf saltbush, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, powdery hairs that reflect sunlight and reduce water loss. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. Its leaves are succulent and can store water, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Atriplex cinerea is often found in saline soils and is used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardiness and ability to stabilize soil.
